The ad isn't saying that all men are to blame, obviously.  It's just encouraging us to look in a mirror a bit to see where we can become better men.  Real men don't freak out at a challenge to do better.

Attacking masculinity has become common on the left, and they mask it by calling it toxic masculinity then accusing all men of needing to have those actions trained out of them.
